Process hazard analyses are conducted with key employees to meet the PSM requirements. During these sessions, situations are risk-ranked according to Aux Sable philosophy and recommendations are made for the purpose of improving safety and preventing accidental chemical releases. Each recommendation is considered for implementation and tracked thru in-house databases. Though not all recommendations may be implemented, all will be considered.  The exercise has provided all affected employees with a heightened awareness of safety issues related to the covered process.

The General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:

The prevention program based on this regulation includes the following: Employee Participation; Process Safety Information; Process Hazard Analysis; Operating Procedures; Training; Contractor Safety; Contractor and Visitor Orientation; Pre-Startup Safety Review; Mechanical Integrity; Management of Change; Incident Investigation; Emergency Planning and Response; and Compliance Audits. Mechanical Integrity includes ultrasonic testing of vessels and piping, material specifications, and other applicable testing/treating procedures.
 
The Emergency Response Program:

Aux Sable Midstream LLC maintains an emergency response plan in compliance with local emergency response agencies. Specifically, the Palermo plant has established and coordinated emergency response action plans with the Stanley Fire Department.  The emergency response plan also includes procedures for responding to releases of regulated substances, including the possibility of associated fires or explosions. The procedures address all aspects of emergency response, including evacuation plans, accounting for personnel after an evacuation, and notification of local emergency response agencies, if a release occurs.
  
Five-Year Accident History:

The Aux Sable Midstream' s Palermo, North Dakota facility has had no accidental releases of regulated flammable materials meeting the five-year accident history requirements of 40 CFR 68.42.

Planned Changes for Improved Safety:

Executive Summary

Aux Sable Midstream LLC, Palermo, North Dakota

The Aux Sable Midstream Palermo Facility is located at 6138 74th Avenue NW, Palermo, North Dakota, in Mountrail County. The plant's location is approximately 4 miles south of Palermo, North Dakota and encompasses a land area of about 40 acres. 
 
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

Aux Sable understands its duty to provide a safe working environment and to take measures to prevent accidents that may have an effect on the surrounding community. This understanding is reflected in procedures described herein. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are represented in the emergency response plan. The Palermo plant takes an active role in preventing accidental releases at all of its facilities by ensuring that its employees are properly trained in the safe operation of covered processes and the safe handling of regulated chemicals. Additionally, the plant has established and maintained site-specific procedures for emergency notification and response. These procedures are reviewed with employees on a periodic basis and revised to accommodate changes in staffing when they occur.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:

The Aux Sable Midstream LLC facility is a natural gas liquids conditioning plant. The plant is designed to improve natural gas quality and make it suitable for pipeline transport. The gas plant receives gas from gathering systems that service nearby Bakken shale oil/gas production areas. The plant separates natural gas condensate from natural gas liquids. All other natural gas liquids (NGL) and natural gas are transported via the Prairie Rose pipeline to the Alliance Pipeline near Bantry, North Dakota for further processing off-site.
